usefulItems: serving platter, baking paper, small bowl
title: Seafood en papillote with saffron potatoes

ingredients.content: 2 sprigs fresh flat-leaf parsley, leaves only
300 g new baby potatoes, peeled and cut into halves (approx. 8)
40 g unsalted butter, cut into pieces
20 fresh mussels, debearded and cleaned (see Tips)

preparations.content: Place parsley into mixing bowl and chop <b>5 sec/speed 6<b>. Transfer into a small bowl and set aside.
Place water and 1 teaspoon of the salt into mixing bowl. Insert simmering basket and weigh potatoes into it and add saffron.

Place Varoma into position and line Varoma dish with a sheet of baking paper (30 x 60 cm). Place fish in a single layer onto baking paper and weigh in butter, vermouth, cream, peas, pepper, remaining ½ teaspoon salt and half of the reserved parsley. Enclose top and sides of paper to form a sealed parcel. Insert Varoma tray and place mussels onto it. Secure Varoma lid and steam <b>20-23 min/Varoma/speed 2<b>, until fish flakes easily, mussels are open and potatoes are cooked through.
Carefully transfer parcel onto a serving platter. Open parcel and serve with potatoes and mussels, garnished with remaining reserved parsley.

hintsAndTricks: For the best result, use fresh fish fillets and fresh mussels in this recipe. Cooking times may vary depending on the type and thickness of fillets used.
You can replace the vermouth with white wine, if desired.
